name.description: Unique asset name within the portfolio.
name.title: Name

cardinality.description: Number of identical asset units represented by this asset entry (>= 1).
cardinality.title: Cardinality

criticality_index.description: Optional criticality index configuration for this asset.

tags.description: Optional list of tags for grouping/filtering assets.
tags.title: Tags

path.description: Logical document path where the issue occurred.
path.title: Path

data.description: Optional data source and feature mapping section.

given.description: Scenario id representing the condition event.
given.title: Given

then.description: Scenario id whose behavior depends on the condition event.
then.title: Then

id.description: Canonical unique control id in the form 'namespace:key' (no whitespace).
id.title: Id

ref.description: Optional structured locator for mapping to an external standard (e.g. CIS/ISO). This is metadata only; referencing should use the canonical 'id'.

implementation_effectiveness.description: Organization-specific implementation strength for this control. Semantics: 0.0 = not implemented / no coverage, 1.0 = fully implemented. This represents vulnerability likelihood (susceptibility) posture used to mitigate a scenario's baseline threat frequency.
implementation_effectiveness.title: Implementation Effectiveness

coverage.description: Breadth of deployment/application across the organization. This contributes to vulnerability likelihood reduction when applying this control to a scenario.

reliability.description: Reliability/uptime of the control as a probability of being effective in a given period.
reliability.title: Reliability

affects.description: Which loss component this control affects. Default is 'frequency' (frequency-first). Note: the current reference engine primarily applies controls to frequency (lambda).
affects.title: Affects

notes.description: Free-form notes about this assessment entry.
notes.title: Notes

id.description: Optional identifier for this assessment pack (organization-owned).
id.title: Id

assessed_at.description: When this assessment pack was performed/recorded (ISO 8601 date-time). Example: '2025-12-17T10:15:30Z'.
assessed_at.title: Assessed At

ControlCatalogEntry.description:
Portable metadata about a control id.

Important: do not embed copyrighted standard text here.
Keep this to identifiers and tool-friendly metadata.

id.description: Canonical unique control id present in this catalog.
id.title: Id

ref.description: Optional structured locator to map the id to an external standard.

title.description: Optional short human-readable title for the control.
title.title: Title

url.description: Optional URL for additional reference material.
url.title: Url

tags.description: Optional list of tags for grouping/filtering.
tags.title: Tags

ControlCatalogEntry.title: ControlCatalogEntry

id.description: Optional identifier for this catalog pack (organization-owned).
id.title: Id

ControlStructuredRef.description:
Standard-independent structured control locator.

This is optional metadata that can be used by tools/UI to help users map
controls, but *referencing* in scenarios/portfolios should be done via
`ControlId`.

Example:
    {standard: "CIS", version: "v8", control: "2", safeguard: "3"}

control.description: Control identifier within the referenced standard.
control.title: Control

ControlStructuredRef.title: ControlStructuredRef

between.description: Pair of scenario ids this correlation applies to.
between.title: Between

method.description: Optional correlation method used by the runtime (engine-defined).
method.title: Method

Coverage.description:
Breadth of application of a control across an organization.

Semantics:
- value=0.0 means "not deployed/applied anywhere in the stated basis"
- value=1.0 means "fully deployed/applied across the stated basis"

The basis defines the denominator for the fraction (e.g. endpoints, employees).

value.description: Coverage fraction in [0, 1] for the stated basis.
value.title: Value

notes.description: Optional free-form notes about how coverage was estimated.
notes.title: Notes

Coverage.title: Coverage

inputs.description: Optional mapping of input names to asset fields/values used by the index.
inputs.title: Inputs

weights.description: Optional weights applied to inputs when computing the criticality index.
weights.title: Weights

transform.description: Optional post-transform applied to the computed index.
transform.title: Transform

sources.description: Optional named data sources referenced by the scenario.
sources.title: Sources

feature_mapping.description: Optional mapping from engine-required feature names to source columns/fields.
feature_mapping.title: Feature Mapping

type.description: Identifier for the data source type (engine/UI defined).
type.title: Type

data_schema.description: Optional schema mapping for source fields (feature name -> type/meaning).
data_schema.title: Data Schema

DependencyCopula.description:
Engine-independent copula dependency specification.

The copula operates over `targets` in the given order.
This version is intentionally minimal and supports Gaussian copulas.

Targets are language-level references. Currently supported targets:
- control:<id>:state  (a control availability/performance state)

targets.description: Ordered list of dependency target references; list length defines the copula dimension.
targets.title: Targets

matrix.description: Optional explicit correlation matrix (dimension must match targets).
matrix.title: Matrix

DependencyCopula.title: DependencyCopula

parameters.description: Model parameters for the selected frequency model.

lambda.description: Threat-event frequency parameter (e.g. Poisson rate). Interpreted as baseline threat likelihood (threat landscape) before organization-specific vulnerability/control posture is applied. Serialized as 'lambda' in YAML/JSON.
lambda.title: Lambda

version.description: Optional version string for this document.
version.title: Version

locale.description: Optional locale/region information and arbitrary locale metadata.
locale.title: Locale

regulatory_frameworks.description: Optional list of regulatory frameworks relevant to this document.
regulatory_frameworks.title: Regulatory Frameworks

assets.description: List of assets/exposures in the portfolio.
assets.title: Assets

controls.description: Optional list of controls present in the organization/portfolio.
controls.title: Controls

control_catalogs.description: Optional list of file paths to referenced control catalog packs.
control_catalogs.title: Control Catalogs

control_assessments.description: Optional list of file paths to referenced control assessment packs.
control_assessments.title: Control Assessments

scenarios.description: List of scenario references included in the portfolio.
scenarios.title: Scenarios

dependency.description: Optional dependency specification for runtime models (e.g. copulas).

PortfolioBundlePayload.description:
Portfolio bundle payload for `CRPortfolioBundle`.

This is intentionally the inlined artifact content; engines should not require filesystem access.

scenarios.description: Scenario documents referenced by the portfolio, inlined.
scenarios.title: Scenarios

control_catalogs.description: Optional inlined control catalog packs referenced by the portfolio.
control_catalogs.title: Control Catalogs

control_assessments.description: Optional inlined control assessment packs referenced by the portfolio.
control_assessments.title: Control Assessments

metadata.description: Optional metadata for traceability (e.g., source refs). Not interpreted by engines.
metadata.title: Metadata

PortfolioBundlePayload.title: PortfolioBundlePayload

require_paths_exist.description: If true, referenced file paths must exist during validation.
require_paths_exist.title: Require Paths Exist

validate_scenarios.description: If true, referenced scenario files are schema-validated during portfolio validation.
validate_scenarios.title: Validate Scenarios

validate_relevance.description: If true, perform additional relevance checks between the portfolio organization context (meta.locale/meta.industries/meta.company_sizes/meta.regulatory_frameworks) and the referenced scenarios. Also validates that portfolio control id namespaces align with declared regulatory frameworks.
validate_relevance.title: Validate Relevance

id.description: Canonical unique control id present in the portfolio inventory.
id.title: Id

implementation_effectiveness.description: Portfolio-level implementation strength for this control (0..1). Represents organization-specific vulnerability likelihood (susceptibility) reduction when applied to a scenario's baseline threat frequency.
implementation_effectiveness.title: Implementation Effectiveness

coverage.description: Breadth of deployment/application across the organization. This contributes to vulnerability likelihood reduction when the control is used to mitigate a scenario's baseline threat frequency.

reliability.description: Reliability/uptime probability for this control being effective in a given period. This is an inventory attribute; runtimes may treat it as a stochastic state.
reliability.title: Reliability

affects.description: Which loss component this control is intended to affect (frequency, severity, or both). Note: the current reference engine primarily applies controls to frequency (lambda).
affects.title: Affects

notes.description: Free-form notes about this portfolio control entry.
notes.title: Notes

copula.description: Optional copula specification for dependency across targets.

method.description: Aggregation semantics used to combine scenario losses.
method.title: Method

anyOf.description: Canonical unique control id in the form 'namespace:key' (no whitespace). Examples: cap:edr, cisv8:4.2, iso27001:2022:A.5.1

controls.description: Optional threat-centric declaration of relevant controls. Semantics: the threat can be mitigated by these controls if present in the portfolio.
controls.title: Controls

applies_to_assets.description: Optional explicit list of portfolio asset names this scenario applies to. Used for per-asset-unit scenarios to define the exposure set.
applies_to_assets.title: Applies To Assets

ScenarioControl.description:
Scenario-specific control reference.

This allows a scenario to specify scenario-scoped assumptions for a control
(e.g. partial applicability) without requiring portfolio-wide changes.

id.description: Canonical unique control id referenced by this scenario.
id.title: Id

potency.description: Scenario-scoped potency factor for this control against this specific threat (0..1). This represents how strong the control is against the scenario if implemented and applied; it is multiplied with portfolio/assessment posture values during planning.
potency.title: Potency

notes.description: Free-form notes about this scenario control reference.
notes.title: Notes

ScenarioControl.title: ScenarioControl

id.description: Unique scenario id within the portfolio.
id.title: Id

path.description: Path to the referenced CRML scenario document.
path.title: Path

weight.description: Optional weight used by some portfolio aggregation methods (model-specific).
weight.title: Weight

binding.description: Optional binding/exposure configuration for this scenario.

tags.description: Optional list of tags for grouping/filtering scenarios.
tags.title: Tags

parameters.description: Model parameters for the selected severity model.

median.description: Median loss value (distribution-dependent). Interpreted as threat impact (monetary loss per event). The reference approach models vulnerability primarily via likelihood (controls); vulnerability impact is not modeled.
median.title: Median

currency.description: Optional currency code/symbol for severity inputs.
currency.title: Currency

mu.description: Distribution parameter (e.g. lognormal mu). Used to parameterize threat impact. Prefer 'median' for human-readable inputs.
mu.title: Mu

sigma.description: Distribution parameter (e.g. lognormal sigma). Controls variability of threat impact (loss per event).
sigma.title: Sigma

single_losses.description: Optional list of explicit sample losses (used by some empirical severity models).
single_losses.title: Single Losses

description:
Engine-agnostic bundle produced by the language layer.

A portfolio bundle is a single, self-contained artifact that contains:
- the portfolio document
- referenced scenario documents inlined
- optionally, referenced control packs inlined

The bundle is intended as the contract between `crml_lang` and engines.

portfolio_bundle.description: The portfolio bundle payload (inlined artifact content).

title: CRPortfolioBundle
